feed.title: Linguistics for NLP
feed.subtitle: My linguistic perspective on NLP research.

entry.title: What should have been a poster at ISCOL

link.title: What should have been a poster at ISCOL

entry.content:
This post will review the paper I presented at SIGMORPHON this year (see link in the publications section), that should have been presented at the ISCOL conference too but eventually didn’t. ___

Getting the ###life out of Living: How adequate are word-pieces for modelling complex morphology?

tldr; not at all.

The task: Part-of-speech Tagging The language: Hebrew The data: The Hebrew treebank The means: fine-tuning Multilingual BERT

The challenge(s) with POS-tagging in Hebrew
entry.summary: This post will review the paper I presented at SIGMORPHON this year (see link in the publications section), that should have been presented at the ISCOL conference too but eventually didn’t. ___ Getting the ###life out of Living: How adequate are word-pieces for modelling complex morphology? tldr; not at all.
